question: You paid a refundable deposit when you rented an apartment. You left the apartment in good condition but the Landlord won't return your deposit.Write a letter to the landlord. In your letterexplain why you are writingask for the return of your depositinform the landlord of possible legal action
text: My name is Artem and I was renting your apartment located near the Sherbrooke metro station. The reason I am writing to you is that I have not received the deposit I made to be able to move in with my cat.

Initially it was prohibited to have a cat due to the contract restrictions. But we agreed if I made a deposit that covers the cost of repairing the flat, it would be possible to add a pet-friendly option in the contract. Additionally, it was mentioned that the financials will be returned as soon as the lease is over. Unfortunately, it has been already a month since I moved out, but I have not received any money.

I am sure that there is some misunderstanding. Could you please clarify what is happening with the return? I am afraid I will have to go to court if the money will not be returned in the near future. Please feel free to contact 43838732202 if you have any information.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you are missing a comma after the introductory phrase Initially. Consider adding a comma.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
